page.title: 15RIDING IN BEDGEBURY AREA
page.content: It is an exhilarating experience to ride in Bedgebury Forest, with its 1500 acres of coniferous and deciduous trees, intersected by unmetalled roads with many tracks leading from them. These have broad grass verges where many different wild flowers grow. As the Forest is closed to unauthorized vehicles this makes it a particularly safe and pleasant place to ride. The number of horses allowed to use this Forestry Commission land is restricted to permit holders only, at Â£20 per horse per annum. This ensures that the horses are kept to a suitable number with no overcrowding or damage to this lovely area. Bedgebury School has an accredited riding centre where pupils and public can learn to ride and study for the British Horse Society's Assistant Instructor qualification.
